  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Kinship takes being Open to All seriously. We encourage applications from individuals underrepresented in their field of study, and those that can potentially add new and valuable perspectives to the pet care and tech industries. Multicultural, Black, Indigenous and students of color, are strongly encouraged to apply

WHAT YOU'LL LEAVE THE EXPERIENCE WITH

  • Experience accessing a robust database, creating queries and developing consumer surveys
  • Experience Collaborating with other scientists

At UiPath we see boundless potential in the way we live. It drives the way we work. Our culture is our most valuable asset, that's why it acts like a compass to us. We're fast, immersed, humble and bold. And that's not just words on the walls.

Eliminating time-consuming tasks means people get to do more of what they love. It's an inspiring, high stakes challenge that motivates us, and this common passion bonds UiPath employees globally. We all strive every day to be better and to accelerate human achievement.

We make robots, but we hire people. Would you like to be part of this journey?

We are looking for Software Engineer Interns to join our Engineering team in Bellevue, WA. For our internship program, we are looking for smart, curious and motivated Computer Science students from top colleges to join us and experience building successful commercial software and services alongside the best and brightest engineering talent in the industry.
Here is what you will be doing at UiPath
    • Build robust and scalable software
    • Participate in brainstorming sessions and supply ideas to our technology, algorithms and products
    • Work with the product and design teams to understand end-user requirements
    • Formulate use cases, and deliver results
What you'll bring to UiPath
    • Enrolled in Bachelor's, Master's or PhD Degree in Computer Science or related field at a highly respected university (final year graduating students preferred)
    • Programming proficiency in one or more object-oriented languages (such as C#/C++/Java) backed by solid computer science fundamentals.
    • Strong desire for learning and contributing.
    • Strong command of object-oriented programming and design patterns.
Life at UiPath like a lot of startups, can sometimes feel like a roller coaster. It comes with changes and challenges, but also with the opportunity to shape how work is done, to have great impact and learn a great deal.
  
At UiPath, we value a range of diverse backgrounds experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes.

UiPath is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you have a medical condition or disability which inhibits your ability to complete any part of the application process, and are in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the process, please contact us @ TALeaders@uipath.com and let us know how we may assist you.

This notice together with our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use of this website and any other documents we mention here are meant to inform you on what personal data about you we collect, use, disclose, share or otherwise process when you are applying for a job at UiPath or when UiPath contacts you for recruitment purposes. Please read this policy carefully to understand our views and practices on how we protect your personal data.

Summary
Posted: Nov 2, 2020
Role Number: 200203730
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Dynamic, amazing people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. The people who work here have reinvented entire industries with all Apple Hardware products. The same passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it. Join us to help deliver the next groundbreaking Apple product. Do you love working on challenges that no one has solved yet? As a member of our dynamic group, you will have the unparalleled and rewarding opportunity to craft upcoming products that will delight and support millions of Apple's customers every single day. The people here at Apple don't just build products, they create the kind of wonder that's revolutionized entire industries. The people who work here have reinvented and defined entire industries with our products and services. It's the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Be ready to make something excellent when you come here. Dynamic, inspiring people and innovative, industry-defining technologies are the norm at Apple. The same passion for innovation also applies to our business practices, strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it. Play a role in bringing autonomous systems into the real world! We are looking for talented and dedicated engineers to help develop our simulation systems that we use to develop, test and verify mobile autonomous systems.
Key Qualifications
  • C++ software engineering skills
  • Excellent computer science fundamentals, data structures and algorithms, distributed systems, concurrent programming, performance profiling
  • Bonus points for: Experience with robotics algorithms, physics modeling, 3D graphics, raytracing, discrete event simulations, computational geometry
  • Bonus points for: Experience with software development practices including design, estimation, agile project management, code reviews, automated testing.
  • Excellent collaboration skills: demonstrated ability to work in a team.
Description
As a member of the team you will: Design, develop and improve our simulation technologies including: system design, feature implementation, code reviews, validation and testing. Collaborate with world class testing, data science, and autonomy teams to deliver our organization-critical simulation platform Work closely with simulation team managers and leads to make high-impact technical decisions about system structure and approaches
Education & Experience
Pursing a Bacheors, Masters or PhD in Computer Science or related field.
Additional Requirements
Education Requirements: Pursing a Bacheors, Masters or PhD in Computer Science or related field.

location.position: Center for Global Security Research Graduate Student Intern
location.description:
Company Description

Join us and make YOUR mark on the World!

Are you interested in joining some of the brightest talent in the world to strengthen the United States’ security? Come join Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) where our employees apply their expertise to create solutions for BIG ideas that make our world a better place.

We are looking for individuals that demonstrate an understanding of working in partnership with team peers, who engage, advocate, and contribute to building an inclusive culture, and provide expertise to solve challenging problems.

Job Description

The Center for Global Security Research (CGSR) was established at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) in 1996 to bring together experts from the science, technology, and policy communities to address pressing national security challenges. For over 20 years, CGSR has engaged diverse perspectives on topics important to national security, deterrence, diplomacy, dual-use technology, arms control, nonproliferation, peacekeeping, cyber defense and energy security.

We have openings for graduate students and student who have received their Bachelor's and Master's degree taking place from March 1, 2021 to May 24, 2021 to engage in practical research experience to further their educational goals. You may conduct research to support United States (US) policy and decision makers in developing strategies for national and international security. Relevant fields of research include nuclear engineering, computational sciences, materials science and engineering, cyber security, interactive data mining, political science, and international relations.

This job will be closed to applicants on January 8, 2021.

In this role you will

  • Support the CGSR organization through contributions to ongoing research activities. Tasks may include literature reviews, annotated bibliographies, and contributions to workshops and summary reports.
  • Provide analysis to ongoing work, involving a moderate to high degree of complexity.
  • May assist in the planning of one workshop to support research effort.
  • Gather and analyze data and information in support of research.
  • Conduct an independent research project on an agreed upon topic aligned with CGSR research priorities.
  • Participate in research planning and evaluation discussions.
  • Attend relevant seminars and/or conferences.
  • Present research to LLNL staff at end of the assignment.
  • May prepare end-of-assignment technical report.
  • Perform all assignments in accordance with ES&H, security, and business practice requirements and policies.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

  • Must be currently enrolled in an accredited university and actively pursuing a graduate degree or have completed a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mathematics, Bio-engineering Psychology, Computer Science, Physical Science, Political Science, or International Relations.
  • Demonstrated academic achievement in Mathematics, Bio-engineering Psychology, Computer Science, Political Science or International Relations.
  • Experience applying basic engineering or scientific principles to solve technical problems.
  • Ability to work in a team environment.


Additional Information

Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?

  • Included in 2020 Best Places to Work by Glassdoor!
  • Work for a premier innovative national Laboratory
  • Comprehensive Benefits Package
  • Flexible schedules (*depending on project needs)
  • Collaborative, creative, inclusive, and fun team environment

Learn more about our company, selection process, position types and security clearances by visiting our Career site.

Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL), located in the San Francisco Bay Area (East Bay), is a premier applied science laboratory that is part of the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) within the Department of Energy (DOE). LLNL's mission is strengthening national security by developing and applying cutting-edge science, technology, and engineering that respond with vision, quality, integrity, and technical excellence to scientific issues of national importance. The Laboratory has a current annual budget of about $1.5 billion, employing approximately 6,000 employees.

LLNL is an affirmative action/ equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Security Clearance

LLNL is a Department of Energy (DOE) and National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) Laboratory. Most positions will require a DOE L or Q clearance (please reference Security Clearance requirement). If you are selected, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. In addition, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. An L or Q clearance requires U.S. citizenship. If you hold multiple citizenships (U.S. and another country), you may be required to renounce your non-U.S. citizenship before a DOE L or Q clearance will be processed/granted. For additional information please see DOE Order 472.2.

Equal Employment Opportunity

LLNL is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer that values and hires a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please submit a request via our online form.

California Privacy Notice

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.

location.position: Engineering Intern - Virtual Training Development Summer 2021
location.description:
Company Description

Corporate Overview

Founded in 1912, Illinois Tool Works (NYSE: ITW) is a global industrial company centered on a differentiated and proprietary business model. The company's seven industry-leading segments leverage the ITW Business Model to generate solid growth with best-in-class margins and returns in markets where highly innovative, customer-focused solutions are required. ITW's more than 50,000 dedicated colleagues around the world thrive in our decentralized, entrepreneurial culture.

Job Description

INTERNSHIP SUMMARY

The ITW Innovation Center provides innovation process and tools workshops for ITW businesses: Automotive, Construction, Food Equipment, Polymer and Fluids, Specialty Products, Test & Measurement and Electronics, Welding.

Under direction, the candidate will leverage the Zoom and MS Teams virtual platforms to convert existing innovation workshop materials and exercises to an interactive and engaging online delivery format. As is feasible, candidates will participate directly with an ITW business to gain experience in their field of educational focus.  

INTERNSHIP DETAIL

This position will be part of a team responsible for Innovation Process workshop delivery within the ITW Innovation Center. This is a minimum 12-week internship located in the ITW Innovation Center on the corporate campus in Glenview, Illinois.

Qualifications

REQUIREMENTS:

  • College sophomore/junior/senior pursuing a degree in Management Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science, Game Development, Computer Engineering, or related experience.
  • A solid knowledge of Zoom or MS Teams and related applications and features, such as Breakout Rooms and Polls.
  • A willingness to engage and collaborate with coworkers in other disciplines.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.

COMPETENCIES:

  • Interpersonal skills & communication: Ability to work collaboratively and partner well with others, express oneself verbally and in writing, with active listening skills.
  • Curiosity & Learning Orientation: Actively identifies new areas for learning and applying newly gained knowledge and skills on the job.
  • Driven to Excel: Willing to go the extra mile to succeed. Perseveres in the face of obstacles and challenges.

Additional Information

Illinois Tool Works Inc. ("ITW" or "the Company") is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability, protected Veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability and are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the online application system process due to your disability, please email [email protected] to request assistance. No other requests will be acknowledged.

Located in Malibu, California, HRL has been on the leading edge of technology, conducting pioneering research and advancing the state of the art.

Education Desired:
Current graduate or exceptional undergraduate student in Physics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or related discipline.

Essential Job Functions:
Develop and use simulation tools to design and evaluate protocols for quantum networking, targeting integrated quantum photonic devices.Translate quantum optical models for real-world devices into code; evaluate resulting simulated performance metrics.Effectively present ideas and results in technical presentations, write research reports, and collaborate and communicate with team members.


Experience and Knowledge Desired:
Coursework or equivalent experience in quantum mechanics, quantum information theory, scientific computing, numerical analysis, high performance computing, and physics-based modeling. Application of scientific software to problems of scientific and technological interest. Knowledge of Python highly desirable.


Essential Physical/Mental Requirements:
Ability to spend extended periods of time at a computer monitor. Excellent problem solving skills. Excellent written and verbal communications skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced heterogeneous team environment.



Special Requirements:
U.S. citizenship is required.

This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a "U.S. Person" as defined by 22 C.F.R. 120.15 is required. "U.S. Person" includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

HRL offers a very competitive compensation and benefits package. Our benefits include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401K match, gym facilities, PTO, growth potential, and an exciting and challenging work environment.
 
HRL Laboratories is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, training or promoting, on the basis of race, ethnicity, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, medical condition, U.S. military or protected veteran status, union membership, or political affiliation. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing. Apply Now

location.position: Systems Engineer Intern, DRIVE AV - Summer 2021
location.description:
NVIDIA's invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI - the next era of computing - with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world! Today, we are increasingly known as "the AI computing company." Are you willing to challenge yourself, and build great software by working with the smartest people in the world? Join us at the forefront of technological advancement.

What you'll be doing:

  • Responsible for the technical relationship and assisting the automotive customer in building creative solutions based on Nvidia technology.

  • Responsible for integrating different hardware and software components optimally for customer products.

  • Provide technical support, bring up customer hardware, debug and resolve system issues.

  • Performing in-vehicle tests, capturing & analyzing data and completing autonomous drive missions.

  • Collaborate with engineering teams in our US, APAC, India and Europe locations.

What we need to see:

  • A general understanding of the main SW technologies used in ADAS and self-driving cars (computer vision, deep learning, path planning, etc.)

  • Experience in the development of embedded systems, including formulating system level requirements, designs and architectures.

  • Customer facing skill-set and background working with developers, researchers, start-ups and established technical/industry partners.

  • Strong knowledge of scripting and Python

  • Excellent C and C++ programming skills

  • Experienced Linux user

  • Pursing BS/MS/PhD degree in computer science, electrical engineering, related technical field, or equivalent experience

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with good attention to details.

  • Experience working with self-driving cars or other real-time robotics/mechatronics systems.

  • Experience with automotive design processes and norms

  • Excellent communication and organization skills, good time management and task prioritization.

  • Dedicated and able to work with minimum supervision.

  • Experience with GPGPU programming (CUDA and OpenCL)

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Company Description

The Bosch Research and Technology Center North America with offices in Sunnyvale, California, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and Cambridge, Massachusetts is part of the global Bosch Group (www.bosch.com), a company with over 70 billion euro revenue, 400,000 people worldwide, a very diverse product portfolio, and a history of over 125 years. The Research and Technology Center North America (RTC-NA) is committed to providing technologies and system solutions for various Bosch business fields primarily in the areas of Human Machine Interaction (HMI), Robotics, Energy Technologies, Internet Technologies, Circuit Design, Semiconductors and Wireless, and MEMS Advanced Design.

At the Services team of the Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence, we apply state of the art Data Analytics technologies and develop standardized tools to enable BOSCH business units to achieve cost savings and enable new IoT business.

Job Description
  • Be part of the technical service and engineering team of the Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence
  • Work in Operations Research and Data Mining projects with real world datasets
  • Formulate and implement optimization models
  • Compare and select optimization algorithms and software packages
  • Perform tasks such as ETL, data cleaning, modeling, model validation and deployment
  • Implement software solutions with Analytics components

Qualifications

Required knowledge and skills:

  • Master's degree in the area of Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar
  • Strong background in mathematical optimization / Operations Research
  • Good programming skills required in at least 2 of the following programming languages: Python, Java, C#, C+, R
  • Experience with optimization software such as Gurobi, Cplex or similar
  • Experience with both exact optimization (LP, MIP, CP) as well as heuristic optimization (construction heuristics, metaheuristics)
  • Excellent problem solving ability
  • Ability to consolidate business and technical requirements
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills with the ability to communicate technical and non-technical topics

Additional skills:

  • Knowledge of Data Mining algorithms is a plus
  • Experience in manufacturing or supply chain applications is a plus
  • Experience in applying Analytics to practical problems preferred

Additional Information

By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled.

BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) Initiatives

  • FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology)
  • AWIM (A World in Motion)

Salelytics is for a person with experience in Office 365 and customer service skills for our Tech Services department. One in Appleton WI and one in San Antonio TX.

Job Description


Responsible for providing assistance to customers needing to resolve problems with their computer systems in an enterprise and multi-site infrastructure by answering service requests; work with the customer to determine the nature of the problem then follow the problem until final resolution; perform daily equipment checks to ensure equipment is functioning properly; monitor enterprise system functions and activities

Job Responsibilities


Technical Services Functions - Participate in providing enterprise-wide computer systems and peripheral support while ensuring adherence to corporate and department policies and procedures

  • Work with customer to determine the nature of the technical problem then follow the problem until the final resolution for the customer 
  • Ensure work orders have been addressed and properly closed out
  • upgrade, configure hardware/software and troubleshoot/maintain corporate PCs and peripherals 
  • Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction is provided during each point of contact with customers
  • Immediately notify appropriate individuals of any problems that could potentially impact production activities.
  • Follow appropriate escalation procedures regarding service requests and complete related follow-up activities as necessary 
  • Maintain confidentiality of information during PC configuration or maintenance
  • Assist department personnel with the configuration and maintenance of data communication systems
  • Implement an action plan including performing required upgrades and installation of PCs and required peripheral equipment.
  • Assist department personnel with the configuration and maintenance of data communication systems
  • Install and repair wiring and cabling as required on location, as necessary provide telecommunications support including telephone installation and maintenance
  • Systems Monitoring and Operations - Perform daily equipment checks to ensure equipment is functioning properly in a multi-site environment.
  • Monitor various system functions and activities, which may include PC equipment, corporate LAN systems, servers, departmental printers, and telecommunications equipment in order to identify issues and resolve them or attempt to resolve them before they cause problems
  • Be proactive to avoid or minimize system problems that could potentially impact production activities.

Minimum Qualifications
 

Applicants for this job will be expected to meet the following minimum qualifications.
 

Education

  • High school diploma or GED required. Associate degree in computer science, MIS, or related field is preferred


Experience

  • Minimum of one-year experience in technical support services or customer service environment required, preferably in a corporate environment
    Technical
  • Minimum one year of PC hardware, Windows operating systems, DOS, PC/LAN environment, monitoring systems and tools required.
  • Minimum one year of corporate applications and systems preferred 


Other

The following physical and mental requirements may be required for this position.


Physical Requirements: 

  • Must be able to list 45 lbs. 
  • Frequently will finger, grasp, and sit
  • Occasionally may be asked to bend, stoop, carry items which may weigh more than 45 lbs,
  • Climb stairs, work in a confined space, crawl, kneel, push, reach above the shoulder, do repetitive motions, stand, walk, or lift objects (some heavy) above the head

About Salelytics


Founded in 1988, Salelytics powers revenue delivery for some of the biggest and best brands in the world using customized coverage models, best-in-class sales analytics, and dedicated Sales Pros.  Our teams perform critical functions that drive back tremendous value to our partners and their customers. 

Headquartered in Appleton, WI Salelytics has 1,300 employees in offices in Appleton, Wausau, & Middleton, WI, San Antonio, TX, and Makati City, Philippines.    

Questions: Give one of our Talent Acquisition Consultants a call today at 920-997-6927 
Applications will be accepted through 12/28/2020.

Salelytics is striving for a diverse workforce.  We encourage Women, Minorities, LGBTQ Community Members, and Veterans to apply.  We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate based on Age, Race, or Sexual Identity/Orientation.

As a member of the Hologic Diagnostics Software Development team the student selected for this project will have the opportunity to work alongside some of the brightest minds in software development and healthcare.
This project includes the opportunity to:

  • Develop the Curve Editor application which will be used by the software assay team 
  • Analyze log trends and develop an application to be used by the software development team and the field service engineers
  • Work on the Hologic NuGet Server 
In this internship the selected student will be actively a part of the software development process, further develop their skills in C# and web application development and design, and database design and implementation.  ** Note: projects are subject to change based on needs and priorities within the SW development department.

We're looking for bright, inquisitive problem solvers who strive to make a difference.

In order to be considered for this internship you must:

  • Be enrolled as a rising junior or senior undergraduate, or a master's degree 
  • Majoring in: Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Software Engineering
  • Have a 3.2/4.0 GPA
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Programming experience/knowledge in: C#, JAVA - Angular, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, WPF, WinForms
  • Understanding/Experience in Web Development, Software Development, Software Design and Documentation

Position Purpose:

  • Learn various job functions within the Managed Care industry and explore various career opportunities
  • Apply academic knowledge and learn new skills by contributing to various projects
  • Research various legal, regulatory, and other topics within functional area and industry
  • Attend training and development presentations to enhance professional competencies

    • Learn about various processes and functions within the Managed Care industry and develop professionally by contributing to projects that support the business.

    Experience/Experience:
    High school diploma or equivalent. Must be enrolled in an undergraduate program at an accredited university or college, preferably in a field related to the hiring department through the internship period.

     

    Basic Purpose:

    - Assist with production support for web based applications that are utilized by providers and health networks.

    - Assist with querying databases.

    - Provide support to end users.

     

    Preferred Qualifications:

    - Enrollment in computer science, information management or related undergraduate program.

Company Description

The Bosch Research and Technology Center North America with offices in Sunnyvale, California, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and Cambridge, Massachusetts is part of the global Bosch Group (www.bosch.com), a company with over 70 billion euro revenue, 400,000 people worldwide, a very diverse product portfolio, and a history of over 125 years. The Research and Technology Center North America (RTC-NA) is committed to providing technologies and system solutions for various Bosch business fields primarily in the areas of Human Machine Interaction (HMI), Robotics, Energy Technologies, Internet Technologies, Circuit Design, Semiconductors and Wireless, and MEMS Advanced Design.

At our location in Pittsburgh, you will be part of a cutting-edge entrepreneurial research environment at the core of Bosch's AI effort and take advantage of academic partnerships via our multi-year sponsorship of leading international universities such as Carnegie Mellon University.

Job Description

We are looking for enthusiastic interns to join our research team to develop novel approaches of using external unstructured or structured information to improve predictions of an NLP model. The most likely scenario involves retrieving evidence to support/refute the model's prediction. More specifically the internship role will focus on the following responsibilities:

  • Design novel algorithms to retrieve and incorporate external knowledge into a model prediction process
  • Technical discussions and creation of new ideas within the existing research team, in order to improve upon the existing solutions
  • Evaluation of the designed approaches using Bosch data as well as publicly available data sets
  • Clean, efficient, and well-documented implementation of new deep learning methods
  • Publish at leading AI conferences, and ultimately shape the future of Bosch products and services.
Qualifications

Qualifications Required:

  • Pursuing a PhD degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Electrical Engineering, or Mathematics
  • 2+ years of experience in Machine Learning, or Deep Learning
  • 2+ years of programming experience
  • 1+ years experience with Pytorch (and possibly other deep learning frameworks)
  • Established publication record in Machine Learning, Information Retrieval, or Natural Language processing
  • Excellent communication skills

Qualifications Desired:

  • Experience with traditional and neural retrieval
  • Experience with Transformer models
  • Familiarity with Knowledge Graphs
  • Broad knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms and principles
  • Experience defining personal research roadmap


Additional Information

Duration of Internship: 3 months

By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled.

If you are a current Motorola Solutions employee, please click this link to apply through your Workday account.

Company Overview

At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline.  Our technology platforms in communications, software, video and services help our customers work safely and more efficiently.  Whether it's helping firefighters see through smoke, enabling police officers to see around street corners, or reliably keeping the lights on in homes and businesses around the world, our work supports those who put their lives on the line to keep us safe.  Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions, and help us usher in a new era in public safety and security.


Department OverviewThe 9-1-1 Call Handling business is made up of two key segments, Emergency Call Routing and Emergency Call Taking. Emergency Call Routing is the next generation IP network combined with software that allows transport of an emergency call, text, video or IOT alert to the correct public safety answering point using geospatial routing. Emergency Call Taking software then presents the call, text, video or IOT alert to a call taker for triage and dispatch of a response. Additional supplemental data - such as real time location of the caller or emergency health profile data can also be displayed to help drive better outcomes.
Job Description

We work in Scrum methodology. You will be responsible for designing, developing, unit testing, and integrating software to support the development, enhancement, and maintenance of elements of the telecommunication infrastructure. You will be responsible for implementing one or several Internship Projects.

Preferred Skills:

Java

Nice To Have:

  • Javascript

  • Unit Testing

  • Agile/Scrum

  • Azure DevOps

  • Git


Basic Requirements

  • Candidate must be pursuing at least a Bachelors in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related engineering degree

  • Must be graduating December 2021 or later


Travel RequirementsNone
Relocation ProvidedNone
Position TypeIntern
Referral Payment PlanYes

Responds to user help requests

Lozier Corporation is an industry leader in providing store fixtures to major retailers across the U.S. and around the world. Headquartered in Omaha, Nebraska, Lozier began manufacturing fixtures in 1956, and originated the basics of today's shelving systems. Today, Lozier has over 4 million square feet of manufacturing and distribution space across facilities located in five states. We are committed to quality and service, building our business around integrity and respect, and investing in our people and communities.

 

We continue to invest in technology and people to ensure we remain competitive in the industry. That means opportunities for you to grow and develop as an employee and individual. Whether you have a clear idea of where you see yourself in your career or not, Lozier has a diverse range of departments with their own challenges and opportunities for growth to explore. You will find a welcoming and team-oriented environment where employees strive to not only help the company succeed but also help each other succeed, too.

 

POSITION SUMMARY

Installs, configures and troubleshoots microcomputers, printers, and software. Also, performs administrative functions for the IT department.                                                                                         

                                                                                                                  

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

  • Installs, configures and troubleshoots hardware (microcomputers, printers, and phones, etc.).

  • Installs, configures and troubleshoots microcomputer software

  • Responds to user help requests

  • Maintains the Lozier microcomputer hardware/software inventory utilizing the inventory management software.

  • Reasonable and reliable attendance.

  • Ability to work and interact well with others.

 

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education:     High school diploma and/or working toward an Associate's degree or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field.

 

Experience:    Microcomputer hardware and software experience

 

Required Skills:

  • Knowledge and technical ability in the area of microcomputer software and hardware. 

  • Effective written/verbal skills, both in person and over the phone

  • Organizational skills

  • Customer service skills

  • Basic problem solving skills

 

SPECIAL DEMANDS

  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs and push/pull up to 25lbs on occasion.

  • Ability to bend/squat/reach/climb on occasion.

location.position: Biosciences & Biotechnology Division Graduate Student Intern
location.description:
Company Description

Join us and make YOUR mark on the World!

Are you interested in joining some of the brightest talent in the world to strengthen the United States’ security? Come join Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) where our employees apply their expertise to create solutions for BIG ideas that make our world a better place.

We are looking for individuals that demonstrate an understanding of working in partnership with team peers, who engage, advocate, and contribute to building an inclusive culture, and provide expertise to solve challenging problems.

Job Description

We have multiple openings for graduate level students and for students who received a bachelor’s or master’s degree to engage in practical research to further their educational goals. Opportunities include both computational and experimental research on problems associated with bioenergy, microbial communities, biodefense, and innate immunity. These positions are in the Biosciences & Biotechnology Division.

In this role you will

  • Students will work with biologists, biochemists and computational scientists engaged in research on specific projects.
  • Under limited direction and supervision, will conduct research in assigned area. 
  • Report and translate data using common software packages on a PC and or Macintosh computer
  • Performs technical assignments of a basic degree of complexity and provide advanced technical support to scientist in scientific research and development projects. 
  • Present work through presentations and/or poster sessions. 

Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Must be a continuing college or university student in good standing at an accredited institution pursuing a graduate degree or has completed their bachelor’s or master’s degree biology, biochemistry, chemistry or a related field.
  • Demonstrated academic achievement in biology, biochemistry, chemistry or a related field.
  • Experience applying basic scientific principles to solve technical problems.
  • Ability to operate PC and/or Macintosh computers to translate and report scientific data.

Qualifications We Desire

  • GPA of 3.0 or above.


Additional Information

Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?

  • Included in 2020 Best Places to Work by Glassdoor!
  • Work for a premier innovative national Laboratory
  • Comprehensive Benefits Package
  • Flexible schedules (*depending on project needs)
  • Collaborative, creative, inclusive, and fun team environment

Learn more about our company, selection process, position types and security clearances by visiting our Career site.

Security Clearance

LLNL is a Department of Energy (DOE) and National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) Laboratory. Most positions will require a DOE L or Q clearance (please reference Security Clearance requirement). If you are selected, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. In addition, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. An L or Q clearance requires U.S. citizenship. If you hold multiple citizenships (U.S. and another country), you may be required to renounce your non-U.S. citizenship before a DOE L or Q clearance will be processed/granted. For additional information please see DOE Order 472.2.

Equal Employment Opportunity

LLNL is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer that values and hires a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please submit a request via our online form.

California Privacy Notice

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.

  • Under limited direction and supervision, will conduct research in assigned area. 
  • Report and translate data using common software packages on a PC and or Macintosh computer
  • Performs technical assignments of a basic degree of complexity and provide advanced technical support to scientist in scientific research and development projects. 
  • Present work through presentations and/or poster sessions. 

Qualifications

Qualifications

  • Must be a continuing college or university student in good standing at an accredited institution pursuing a graduate degree or has completed their bachelor’s or master’s degree biology, biochemistry, chemistry or a related field.
  • Demonstrated academic achievement in biology, biochemistry, chemistry or a related field.
  • Experience applying basic scientific principles to solve technical problems.
  • Ability to operate PC and/or Macintosh computers to translate and report scientific data.

Qualifications We Desire

  • GPA of 3.0 or above.


Additional Information

Why Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory?

  • Included in 2020 Best Places to Work by Glassdoor!
  • Work for a premier innovative national Laboratory
  • Comprehensive Benefits Package
  • Flexible schedules (*depending on project needs)
  • Collaborative, creative, inclusive, and fun team environment

Learn more about our company, selection process, position types and security clearances by visiting our Career site.

Security Clearance

LLNL is a Department of Energy (DOE) and National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) Laboratory. Most positions will require a DOE L or Q clearance (please reference Security Clearance requirement). If you are selected, we will initiate a Federal background investigation to determine if you meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information or matter. In addition, all L or Q cleared employees are subject to random drug testing. An L or Q clearance requires U.S. citizenship. If you hold multiple citizenships (U.S. and another country), you may be required to renounce your non-U.S. citizenship before a DOE L or Q clearance will be processed/granted. For additional information please see DOE Order 472.2.

Equal Employment Opportunity

LLNL is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer that values and hires a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, protected veteran status, age, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please submit a request via our online form.

California Privacy Notice

The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) grants privacy rights to all California residents. The law also entitles job applicants, employees, and non-employee workers to be notified of what personal information LLNL collects and for what purpose. The Employee Privacy Notice can be accessed here.

This is what you'll do:
       Develop applications for auto-generating automation controls for manufacturing equipment including:

       Develop applications that allow for agile software development for automation controls including:

       Work with databases and HMI platforms to design SCADA applications for providing maximum visibility into the realtime and historical performance of the automation lines.

       Experience working with databases such as Microsoft SQL
       Experience working with continuous integration & continuous deployment (CICD) pipeline tools such as Jenkins is a plus
       Understanding of manufacturing automation controls is a plus

Rivian description:
Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract. 
 
As a company, we constantly challenge what's possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations. 
 
We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois. 
 
Rivian is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Rivian is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Rivian are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Rivian will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Rivian encourages applicants of all ages.

At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. You'll always feel empowered and valued here. 

 

Putting you first

As an intern, you will gain hands-on experience at a high-growth company that values its people. You'll earn a competitive starting wage while absorbing a culture that emphasizes collaboration, entrepreneurial thinking and quick decision-making. Start doing the best work of your life here.

 

What you'll do as a Digital Tech Intern:

  • You'll work in an Agile, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code and test innovative applications, and support those applications for our highly valued customers.
  • You'll employ User Centric Design Thinking to create products that provide a great user experience along with high performance, security, quality, and stability.
  • You'll work with a variety of modern UI / application solutions (Node.js, React.JS, JavaScript), Micro Service / RESTful API Development (Docker, Mulesoft, Java, Node.JS), Database integration (SQL, Oracle, MongoDB), Data analytics ( Adobe Analytics, Tableau) and operating systems (Linux, Windows, iOS, Android).
 

You could be a great fit if you have:

  • Two or more years of undergraduate experience in Computer Science or related field
  • A passion for creating and supporting great products.
  • Collaborated and worked side by side with people of all backgrounds and disciplines; you also have strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Exceptional problem solving skills, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues.
  • A basic understanding of software development and programming in a language such as Java, Javascript, Node .JS or Python
  • Basic concepts for both relational and non-relational database systems.

Job Demands:

  • Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.
  • Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person.

Own your work and your career - apply now

Are you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.

 

We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability-that's the First Republic way.

 

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. The Company is an equal opportunity employer. In this regard, the Company makes reasonable accommodations for qualified applicants and employees with disabilities in order to enable them to perform all essential job functions, unless doing so creates an undue hardship.

 

First Republic is subject to federal laws that restrict the employment of individuals with certain types of criminal histories, including FDIA Section 19 and FINRA. To the extent not inconsistent with our obligations under those federal laws and regulations, First Republic will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles and San Francisco ban-the-box laws.

Virtual Internship

 

Participation in the Research Internship Program requires that you are physically located in the United States or Canada for the duration of the internship.

 

Research Internships at Microsoft provide a dynamic environment for research careers with a network of world-class research labs led by globally-recognized scientists and engineers. Our researchers and engineers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including computing, healthcare, economics, and the environment.

 

The Office of the Chief Technology Officer Social Technology (OCTOST) group advises the company's leaders on the social implications of technology and how Microsoft can help direct the future of technology and the tech industry to address significant social challenges, such as climate change, inequality, stagnant productivity and threats to democracy. We build closely on research in a range of disciplines, especially economics, political science, sociology, law, computer science and philosophy and we engage in significant external engagements with the research community and beyond. Our primary focus is on social impact through engagement with our leaders and product, legal and strategic groups throughout the company.

 

Employment Type: Internship

Your opportunities for achievement are limitless with Northrop Grumman Mission Systems.

An internship at Northrop Grumman is unique. Sure, you'll learn new skills, explore out enterprise, network with experts, connect with thought leaders, and finish with a resume that opens doors. But you'll gain something even more valuable: pride in what you've done. Join us and launch your career. We'll support you with training, employee resource groups, and our shared vision of global security.

Northrop Grumman is seeking Manufacturing Engineers. This position will be located at our Mission Systems Sector in Rolling Meadows, IL.

The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman's Manufacturing organization. The selected candidate will work in a fast paced environment where he/she will interact with multiple disciplines.

As an intern, you'll participate in a summer internship program to develop competencies in a variety of manufacturing engineering specializations that may include:

Roles and Responsibilities

  • Designs manufacturing processes, procedures, production and testing layouts for assemblies, equipment installation, processing, machining and material handling.
  • Designs arrangement of machines within plant facilities to ensure most efficient and productive layout.
  • Designs sequence of operations and specifies procedures for the fabrication of tools and equipment and other functions that affect product performance.
  • Hands-on assembly and testing, to analysis of failure trends, and root cause/ corrective action.
  • Designs, develops, and implements testing methods and equipment.
  • Adapts machine or equipment design to factory and production conditions. May incorporate inspection and test requirements into the production plan.
  • Inspects performance of machinery, equipment, and tools to verify their efficiency, and investigates and initiates corrective action of problems and deficiencies to ensure product quality.
  • Provides guidance to engineering regarding design concepts and specification requirements to best utilize equipment and manufacturing techniques.
  • Ensures processes and procedures are in compliance with regulations. 

Basic Qualifications

A candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:

  • Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2021.
  • Be majoring in Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Physics or closely relate discipline      
  • Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
  • Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2021
  • Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.25/4.0 or higher
  • Previous internship/co-op experience, leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular)
  • Experience in developing and delivering presentations and leading small groups
  • Experience in working on business or engineering full life-cycle projects from inception through launch
  • Experience in working in an autonomous work environment on complex projects


Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Software Engineer
Software Engineer needed for a technology company empowering restaurants and retailers with on-demand delivery!!

Using your online ordering solution, we dispatch crowdsourced drivers already in your neighborhood. We then complete your transaction with a seamless Door-to-Door experience your customers will love. Everyone profits. Everyone saves. Its really that simple. We are one of the fastest growing white label delivery companies in the US today, partnering with top platforms and retailers like Walmart, Whataburger, and 7-Eleven.

As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for building and maintaining the technology that powers our entire business. You will work closely with Product and QA teams to build systems that support partner integration, order fulfillment and the driver experience.
What You Will Be Doing
- Build APIs and publishers for other Applications to leverage our systems
- Engineer data access controls as well as validation and quality checks into the system
- Implement the solution in Azure using containers and CI/CD pipelines
- Identify, scope, and architect solutions for new features
- Work closely with Product, Design, and QA to deliver world-class digital experiences
- Lead initiatives within the team, including technical design / delivery of complex features across multiple systems
- Develop technical roadmaps and lead engineers across one or more teams to deliver initiatives
What You Need for this Position
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, engineering discipline, or equivalent experience
- 3+ years of professional experience in software development

You should know some of the following:

- .NET
- JavaScript
- HTML/CSS
- React/Angular
- Python
- Ruby
What's In It for You
- Competitive compensation and base salary
- Full benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision
- Remote-Work Flexibility
- Life Insurance coverage
- Uncapped PTO
- Vacation, sick, and paid holidays

Software Engineer
Software Engineer needed for a business services company providing innovative technology solutions and services to state governments!

We have been empowering the government since 2005 providing cutting-edge solutions employing the latest in web, mobile, and desktop technologies, all while maximizing compatibility with legacy systems. Our services are optimized for performance and scalability, our software is always ready to adapt to your evolving needs and requirements.

As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining internet applications and related systems.
What You Will Be Doing
- Support all phases of the application development process.
- Code, test, debug, and document software components and applications
- Translate business-specific requirements into software components and applications
- Provide user-support for web software applications
What You Need for this Position
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, engineering discipline, or equivalent experience
- 3+ years of professional experience in software development

You should know some of the following:

- C#
- .NET Core, ASP.NET, MVC 4/5, LINQ, WebAPI
- SQL
- HTML/CSS
- JavaScript
- ReactJS/AngularJS/Vue
- REST
- GraphQL
What's In It for You
- Competitive compensation and base salary
- Full benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision
- Remote-Work Flexibility
- Life Insurance coverage
- Uncapped PTO
- Vacation, sick, and paid holidays

Our client in Phoenix is looking to bring on 15-20 Software Engineers for a full time position. These candidates need to at least 2 years of experience in an Object Oriented language (Java, Node, Golang, C#, etc). They will be learning Golang, but no experience is required for the position.

Top Skills Details

1. Software Engineer
2. Java, Node or GoLang (preferred)
3. Design and development of Rest APIs

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field followed by 2 - 4 years of experience in a modern development stack (Java, Node, or Golang preferred).
  • Experience in application design, software development, and testing, preferably in an Agile environment.
  • Experience working with Git on small to medium sized teams.
  • Experience with open source frameworks is a plus – especially maintaining or contributing to open source projects!
  • Experience with relational and NoSQL databases, including PostgreSQL, Couchbase, or Cassandra is a plus.
  • Experience designing and developing REST APIs for high volume clients.
  • Experience with continuous integration tools (Jenkins, Gitlab CI) a plus.
  • Experience with automated build and test frameworks a plus.
  • A proven hunger to learn new technologies and translate them into working software.
  • Experience with container and container orchestration technologies, such as Docker and Kubernetes, a plus.
  • Experience with Atlassian software development and collaboration tools (Bitbucket, JIRA, Confluence, etc.), a plus.
  • Aptitude for learning and applying programming concepts.
  • Ability to effectively communicate with internal and external business partners.

SUMMARY

Apollo Medical Holdings, together with its subsidiary, Network Medical Management (NMM), is a healthcare management and population health management company forging the path towards a novel, integrated, value-based care model. We are building a next-generation integrated healthcare delivery platform that provides solutions to physicians, health plans, hospitals, and other health providers. We combine our years of clinical expertise and best-in-class delivery network with a proprietary technology platform to dramatically improve patient outcomes and make healthcare delivery and management more efficient. With over a million managed lives across the country and terabytes of medical data generated, our software and applications need to be cutting-edge, efficient, and aligned with our core values of improving the experiences of our patients and physicians.

We are aggressively growing our software engineering team. The role will involve rapidly designing and building new applications and features that can scale efficiently to support our growth. The ideal candidate is a critical thinker who is highly versatile and excited to roll up her sleeves to tackle complex and important problems. The candidate can expect responsibility, ownership, and a decision-making voice in reshaping the future of healthcare delivery, and thus should be passionate and committed to our mission of delivering superior patient outcomes and making U.S. healthcare more efficient.

As a software engineer, you will be responsible for developing and enhancing applications that will be used both internally and by our thousands of physicians and millions of patients. In addition, you will:

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance our software and applications
  • Clearly and regularly communicate with management and technical support colleagues
  • Clearly document procedures and code
  • Manage individual project requirements, priorities, and deliverable timelines effectively
  • Display leadership qualities and ability to take ownership of technical projects and processes

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related, or related experience
  • Experience in software development using at least one general purpose programming language (such as Python, C#, VB.NET, etc.)
  • Experience with SQL
  • Experience in some of the following technical aspects: web application and interface development, developing and designing large software systems, web scraping and other automation scripting, data science, machine learning
  • Strong general problem-solving and logical reasoning ability

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Further education or experience in computer science, engineering, or related fields
  • Experience in full stack development or building applications from scratch
  • Expert in at least one general programming language (such as Python, C#, VB.NET, etc.) and experience with Python
  • Expert in MS SQL Server, including development of stored procedures, triggers, and functions
  • Prior healthcare or managed care experience (eligibility, claims, utilization management, HIPAA requirements, etc.)

Responsibilities:

  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively on small cross functional teams, designing application features collaboratively with product managers, creative designers, technical leads, and Quality Assurance. Create functional specifications and design documentation as needed.
  • Must be a critical thinker and problem solver while considering technical and business needs, requirements and trade-offs. Able to calmly and objectively deal with challenges.
  • Must be a great team player and collaborator.
  • Deliver features and projects from specification all the way through to release.
  • Must be motivated, self-driven, and demonstrate creative thinking capabilities.
  • Must have strong communication skills with the ability to explain and write clear technical designs and ideas to peers, QA, and management team members.
  • Effective organization skills with a self-managed proactive work style.

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of relevant work experience in developing and delivering high quality web applications.
  • 5+ years of technical object-oriented front-end and middle-tier development programming experience in languages such as AngularJS, CSS, HTML5, C#, and PHP; full-stack development experience is a preference. Proficient in SQL and understanding of relational database and schema creation.
  • Experience with JSON and RESTful web services.
  • 5+ years of experience performing peer code reviews, defect analysis, and writing unit tests and test tools.
  • Proven track record of delivering high quality, scalable software with a cohesive user experience.
  • Must be a top-notch problem solver.
  • Ideally would be able to work proficiently on at least two varied platforms.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively both within a team and cross-group to drive identification and resolution of issues to ship under tight deadlines.
  • Must be highly motivated with a strong passion for and commitment to software quality.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage work to meet critical project timelines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent communication skills, ability to make and influence decisions, and drive open discussions to closure.
  • Must excel in both individual and group settings.
  • BS in Computer Science or Engineering or related field preferred.

Remote Technical Recruiting Internship Program

KT consulting is a forward-thinking, fast-paced Government Contracting company looking to hire Recruiting Interns with strong knowledge and understanding of communication, social interactions, attention to detail, and business relationships and development. Recruiting Interns must also have a sense of urgency and a constant drive for improvement.

The Recruiting Interns selected for this program must possess strong critical thinking skills in order to integrate into our vibrant and passionate team, who are very excited to share this launch with an intern hoping to gain extensive experience.

Recruiting Intern Responsibilities

· Contribute to daily operations by providing the required number of Applicant Profiles, Applicants, Candidates, and Candidate Resumes

· Monitor and shadow Technical Recruiters progress and strategize daily objectives

· Assist with online outreach to Applicant Profiles, Applicants, and Candidates via phone and email, engaging in calculated and strategic conversations to gather information for Technical Qualification

· Source Applicant Profiles, Applicants, and Candidates Resumes through multiple Job Boards including Facebook, LinkedIn, Zip Recruiter, Monster, Career Builder, Clearance Jobs, and others

· Perform data analysis and trend reporting on Company Recruiting Operations

Participation Benefits

· Practical experience with real-world Technical Positions for Federal Government Clients

· Shadowing, mentoring, and training opportunities with experienced and knowledgeable Recruiting Professionals

· Opportunity to participate in networking events and Company Meetings

· Flexible schedule for students

· Compensation available

Company Objectives

· Provide Recruiting Assignments that complement Academic Programs and/or Career Development interests

· Give broad exposure to the company and Federal Government Industry

· Provide adequate, reliable, and regular supervision and mentoring

· Ensure interns are keeping pace and accomplishing Recruiting Operations goals and objectives

· Provide formal performance feedback via 3 Month Performance Evaluation and Final Program Performance Assessment

· Help interns create a Professional Network

· Foster Federal Industry Experience and Professional Work Experience

Role of an Internship Program Coordinator and Mentor

Each intern will be assigned a Mentor by the Program Coordinator. Interns will look to their mentors and/or supervisors to help them transition from the classroom to the workplace. It is recommended that mentors and/or supervisors regularly meet with interns to receive and provide feedback concerning their performance. During these meetings the Recruiting Interns may:

· Report on a project’s status

· Learn how their work is contributing to the organization

· Participate in evaluating their strengths

· Discuss areas needing growth and development

· Get an insight about what work lies ahead

Mentors will also assist with the following.

· Developing learning goals

· Meeting with an intern regularly to evaluate performance and if needs/goals are being met and assessing the internship program’s success

· Conducting the 3 Month Performance Evaluation

· Conducting the Final Program Performance Assessment

In addition to the Program Coordinator, a Mentor may assist with transition into the new learning environment. This is done by answering general questions related to personal and professional growth and sharing career knowledge leading to networking in the field.

Qualifications

Only the best and brightest need apply!!! To be considered for the Recruiting Internship Program – Summer/Fall or Winter/Spring internship, you must:

· Maintain an overall GPA of 3.0 or higher

· Major in Public Relations, Communications, Social Science, Business, English, or Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics

· Plan to pursue a career in Recruiting, Human Resources, Talent Acquisition, Business, Program Management, Government Services, or Military Service

· Be a Senior or Alumni Graduate

· Applicants are responsible for transportation to and from the Internship Experience

· Hours are flexible and adjustable to the Student’s Class Schedule, Course Requirements (if applicable) and Availability

· Full Time Employment: 40 hours per week

· Paid Internship: Hourly Rate – confirmed during an interview

Skills Requirements

· Must possess excellent Computer Skills

· Must possess proven Internet Research Skills

· Must possess excellent verbal and written Communication Skills

· Must possess excellent focus and attention to detail

· Must possess knowledge of Candidate Sourcing Methodologies, Tools, and Techniques

· Must possess knowledge of Database Mining and Boolean Search Strings

· Knowledge of Linked-In Recruiter is preferred

Duties and Responsibilities

Recruiting Interns will be responsible for a number of duties that will be administered through their Mentors. Recruiting Interns will have clear direction on daily basis, regarding expectations and goals that will directly correspond with the Program Objectives.

· Build and manage Candidate Labor Pools for Standard Technical & Engineering Positions

· Identify Candidates through various Recruiting Channels including Networking, Job Boards, Social Media, and Internet Recruiting

· Contact Candidates to determine Position Interest and Candidate Availability

· Qualify Candidates using Position Minimum Qualifications

· Track Sourcer Activity and Candidate Communications using Applicant Tracking System

Post Program Objectives for Intern

Upon completion of the KTC Recruiting Internship Program, Recruiting Interns will participate in a Final Program Performance Assessment. The objective of this Performance Assessment is to review the intern’s performance and successful completion of the program. This interview will be conducted by the intern’s Program Mentor and will also be reviewed by the Company President, who may also conduct or attend the Final Program Performance Assessment. After graduating from the program, Recruiting Interns will have an opportunity to become a Technical Recruiter Consultant or Technical Recruiter Analyst. Each position will include:

· Full Time Employment

· Company Benefits

· Starting Salary of $48,000 or higher depending on Program Performance

Brain Corp is a San Diego-based AI company creating transformative core technology for the robotics industry. Our diverse engineering teams in Software, Hardware Design, and Embedded Systems are creating comprehensive solutions to support the builders of today's autonomous machines in successfully producing, deploying, and supporting commercial robots across industries and applications. Brain Corp is funded by the SoftBank Vision Fund and Qualcomm Ventures. For more information please visit: https://www.braincorp.com/   

Position Summary: 

As a member of the Software Engineering team, the Software Engineer will be working on a newly launched product and will help to solve complex problems in the material handling space. As a core member of our AI & Platform Division, you will work with our world-class team of engineers and scientists to build a platform for the next generation of intelligent machines.  Your experience will be pivotal in advancing our mission: safe and reliable robots everywhere.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Deliver software features/functionality that increases customer value and product scalability.
  • Increase the agility/software release frequency of the team and organization through code refactoring, simplification, and removal.
  • Review performance metrics of production fleet as a key indicator of customer experience from which to identify software product improvements.
  • Coordinate with cross-functional areas of expertise including hardware, firmware, platform, user experience, quality, and cloud engineering to deliver world-class customer value.
  • Remain up to date with developments across platform, navigation, and other robots, in order to leverage and contribute towards software innovation across all products.
  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

What you need:

  • Bachelor's Degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.
  • 2-4 years of experience writing python, Golang, or Javascript applications for Linux.
  • Experience coding at an industry level with a strong background in programming constructs and idioms.
  • Experience designing/developing/testing/deploying/maintaining features and software releases.
  • Experience developing applications deployed in the cloud.
  • Solid understanding of design patterns, data structures, and advanced programming techniques.
  • Experience with version control systems such as git.
  • Desire to constantly learn as well as teach others.
  • Strong analytical skills that enable data-driven decisions and prioritization.

Things that make a difference:

  • Master of Science degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience building and maintaining data pipelines and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL), e.g. Kafka, Airflow, Spark Streaming.
  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • Experience with REST APIs, databases, Docker, and Kubernetes.
  • Experience with instrumentation and monitoring (e.g. Prometheus, InfluxDB, Jaeger).
  • Experience with continuous integration, deployment and release management tools.
  • Experience with Agile and Scrum methodology.
  • Proven system integration and software architecture skills
  • Good working knowledge of robotics and surrounding systems
  • General understanding of compliance and regulatory frameworks, including Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX), General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), International Organization for Standards (ISO) 27001 and cloud security implementations.
  • Experience responding to customer information security and/or compliance inquiries and audits.

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Essential functions may require maintaining the physical condition necessary for sitting, walking or standing for periods of time; operating a computer and keyboard; talk and hear at normal room levels; using hands to finger, grasp, and feel; repetitive motion; close visual acuity to prepare and analyze data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; lift, push, carry, or pull up to 10 pounds.

Work Environment:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate. Employee is exposed to the typical office environment with computers, printers and telephones.
